intro: Potentilla strigosa f. alpestris, commonly known as the alpine cinquefoil, is a low-growing shrub characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellowish-white flowers. It is native to alpine regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm and has compound leaves with five elliptical leaflets. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variety is valued for its hardiness and is often used in rock gardens or alpine habitats.
